name: labelconvert
description:
Convert a connectome node image from one lookup table to another.

Typical usage is to convert a parcellation image provided by some other software, based on the lookup table provided by that software, to conform to a new lookup table, particularly one where the node indices increment from 1, in preparation for connectome construction; examples of such target lookup table files are provided in share//mrtrix3//labelconvert//, but can be created by the user to provide the desired node set // ordering // colours.

References:
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au)

inputs.name: lut_in
inputs.description: the connectome lookup table corresponding to the input image

inputs.name: lut_out
inputs.description: the target connectome lookup table for the output image

inputs.name: spine
inputs.description: provide a manually-defined segmentation of the base of the spine where the streamlines terminate, so that this can become a node in the connection matrix.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.
